channel.title: BUscience
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUscience, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Researchers complete the largest compilation of cancer prevalence across vertebrates
item.description: For all its pervasiveness and the efforts to study it, cancer is still somewhat of a mystery. Why do some animals get it at a higher rate than others?...

item.title: Lead pollution in a remote Tibetan glacier reveals far-reaching human activities
item.description: The Tibetan Plateau's glaciers are among the world's most remote and untouched places. Researchers say these ice fields provide water for millions of ...

item.title: How mammals got their stride
item.description: Researchers reveal new insights into the complex evolutionary history behind the distinctive upright posture of modern placental and marsupial mammals...

item.title: Watershed moment: Engineers invent high-yield atmospheric water capture device for arid regions
item.description: As a megadrought stresses the water supply throughout the Southwest, revolutionary research is answering this problem with a groundbreaking technology...

item.title: Saturn's moon Titan has insulating methane-rich crust up to six miles thick
item.description: A new study has revealed that methane gas may be trapped within the icy surface of Saturn's moon Titan, forming a distinct crust up to six miles thick...

item.title: Supporting women in ocean sciences

item.title: This week with NSF Director Panchanathan

item.title: Sounding the alarm: Fire's speed is more threatening than its size
item.description: Most news reports about wildfires include the number of acres a given fire has burned, but according to a new study by U.S. National Science Foundatio...

item.title: 'Well-man' thrown from castle identified from 800-year-old Norse saga

item.title: Snakes don't go with their gut, they regenerate it
